medicalHistory.familyHistory: Mother has diabetes, Father has high blood pressure, Maternal grandmother had breast cancer

admission.symptomsComplaints: Persistent cough for 2 weeks, mild fever, fatigue
admission.medicationsPrescribed: Azithromycin 250mg daily for 5 days, Dextromethorphan cough syrup
admission.treatmentPlan: Antibiotic course, rest, increased fluid intake, follow-up if symptoms persist

testResults.doctorComments: Mild leukocytosis consistent with bacterial infection

testResults.testResult: Clear lung fields, no consolidation or effusion
testResults.doctorComments: No evidence of pneumonia, consistent with upper respiratory infection

dischargeSummary.finalDiagnosis: Acute bronchitis with upper respiratory infection
dischargeSummary.medicationsForHome: Azithromycin 250mg daily for 5 days, Dextromethorphan cough syrup as needed, continue Albuterol inhaler as needed
dischargeSummary.dischargeInstructions: Complete full course of antibiotics, rest for 3-5 days, increase fluid intake, use humidifier, return if fever persists >3 days or breathing difficulties develop
